titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Bernice Kert papers FA236

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-04-01 09:47:45 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The children of Bernice Kert donated her papers to the Rockefeller Archive Center by deed of gift dated March 16, 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bernice Galansky Kert (1923-2005), writer and biographer, was author of The Hemingway Women: Those Who Loved Him (1983) and of Abby Aldrich Rockefeller: The Woman in the Family (1993).

Born in St. Louis, Missouri, Kert received her bachelor's degree in English from the University of Michigan in 1944. She continued on as a graduate teaching assistant in the English Department from 1946-1947. In 1945, she married Lt. Morley J. Kert, M.D., and they moved to Beverly Hills, California, in 1948, where they raised their three children. In addition to the two biographies, Kert published several short stories and wrote three novels.

Kert began work on her biography of Abby Aldrich Rockefeller in the late 1980s. In 1988, she received a John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation fellowship to support her research. She also was a scholar in residence at the Rockefeller Foundation's Bellagio Conference Center in April-May 1991. Bernice Kert's Abby Aldrich Rockefeller was published by Random House in 1993, and it was reissued in a paperback edition in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bernice Kert papers relate to her work researching and writing her biography of Abby Aldrich Rockefeller: The Woman in the Family (1993). The collection contains background research and reference materials, copies of archival materials, correspondence (1986-2001), research notes, manuscript drafts, and a series of recorded interviews with family members and other associates. The collection also includes Kert's diary for 1990, when she traveled to Russia to attend a conference on Hemingway.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Preliminary processing has been done to gain intellectual and physical control of the collection and facilitate access. Additional processing in the future would be warranted to take further preservation and arrangement actions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Archive Center has legal title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.
